intro: Clethra longipedicellata, commonly known as sweet pepperbush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly serrated edge. Clethra longipedicellata thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
